the main functionality of the api is for loan intermediaries and the purpose of the api is to provide a platform for lending and spending. the api supports the following endpoints:

- post /calculator/cost: this endpoint is used to calculate the interest rates and monthly installments for a loan application.
- post /application/maex: this endpoint is used to create a new loan application from a maex import.
- get /application/{applicationid}: this endpoint is used to find a loan application by its id.
- put /application/{applicationid}/cancel: this endpoint is used to cancel a loan application with a given feedback reason and an optional comment.
- put /application/{applicationid}/maex: this endpoint is used to update an existing loan application from a maex import xml. only possible when the loan application can be changed.
- get /application/{applicationid}/contract: this endpoint is used to get the loan application contract pdf.
- post /application/{applicationid}/ready-for-review: this endpoint is used to submit an application for review by lender & spender. only possible when the application is complete.
- post /application/{applicationid}/document: this endpoint is used to add a file to a document.
- get /application/{applicationid}/document/{fileid}: this endpoint is used to get the contents of the file.
- delete /application/{applicationid}/document/{fileid}: this endpoint is used to delete a file from a document.
- put /application/{applicationid}/question/{questionid}: this endpoint is used to provide an answer to a question [in beta].
- post /application/{applicationid}/goods-or-services-delivered: this endpoint is used to submit an invoice for payout after goods or services have been delivered.

the api summary provided is about a "client information api." the main functionality and purpose of this api are to manage client data, including adding new clients, retrieving client information, updating client information, and deleting clients. the api supports four main endpoints:

- post /clients: allows the creation of a new client entry in the system.
- get /clients/{sigmalogin}: retrieves information for a specific client using their unique identifier, in this case, the `sigmalogin`.
- put /clients/{sigmalogin}: updates the information of an existing client identified by their `sigmalogin`.
- delete /clients/{sigmalogin}: deletes a client from the system based on their `sigmalogin`.

the main functionality and purpose of this api is to manage users in your organization using the single sign-on (sso) solution. it allows you to automate the provisioning of product licenses for these users and enables them to access your company's sso solution. the api provides endpoints for managing groups and users, and it uses the scim protocol to communicate with the sso solution. the api supports the following operations:

1. get /groups : get a list of groups
2. post /groups : create a new group
3. delete /groups/{groupkey} : delete a group
4. get /groups/{groupkey} : get a specific group
5. patch /groups/{groupkey} : update a group
6. put /groups/{groupkey} : replace a group
7. get /schemas/users : get the user schema
8. get /serviceproviderconfigs : get the service provider configurations
9. get /users : get a list of users
10. post /users : create a new user
11. get /users/me : get the current user
12. patch /users/me : update the current user
13. put /users/me : replace the current user
14. delete /users/{userkey} : delete a user
15. get /users/{userkey} : get a specific user
16. patch /users/{userkey} : update a user
17. put /users/{userkey} : replace a user
